cited_protocols.title: RNA extraction from hairy roots of common bean (Phaseolus vulgaris L.) and cDNA synthesis

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8p6vj","text":"Extracting RNA for subsequent quantification of transcript levels by RT-qPCR requires high purity and concentration. When the amount of tissue is not abundant, as is the case with hairy roots, the concentration of RNA is frequently low. Here we present an optimized protocol for TRIzol-mediated RNA extraction from hairy roots of common bean. This protocol is based on the manufacturer's instructions   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":401,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8d53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":3341,"mol_weight":0,"name":"TRIzol Reagent","linfor":"","url":"https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/15596026","sku":"15596026 ","cas_number":"","rrid":"","public":1,"can_edit":0,"guid":"AAB34A20DBDF11ED8F37B5C854D08857","entries":null,"vendor":{"id":95,"name":"Thermo Fisher Scientific","link":"https://www.thermofisher.com/us/en/home.html","is_requested":false,"image":{"source":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png","placeholder":"/img/vendors/placeholder.png"}}}}}}
